intro: Viguieranthus scottianus, commonly known as the Scottish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or heathland environments. Viguieranthus scottianus is a rare and endangered species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
